content: the chart on the sole k1 ssk *k1 sl1 * repeat from * to * until 4 sts before bor k1 k2tog k1 foot switch to cc which should be waiting for you here at the bor round 1 cc work instep sts according to the chart knit across sole sts round 2 decrease round cc work instep sts according to the chart on the sole k1 ssk k until 3 sts before bor k2tog k1 round 3 mc work instep sts according to the chart knit across sole sts round 4 decrease round mc work instep sts according to the chart on the sole k1 ssk *k1 sl1 * repeat from * to * until 4 sts before bor k1 k2tog k1 repeat until 56 64 72 80 total stitches remain stopping after a decrease round if you prefer a larger/smaller foot you may decrease to a larger/smaller stitch count - you ll just need to make some adjustments to the toe later on capacitor socks v1 0 - shuyi wu - 3 continue as established but without decreases for the remainder of the foot on the instep work according to the chart on the sole knit across but on every 4th round the 2nd mc round work *k1 sl1* across the sole sts end the pattern after row 2 or 10 for best results if needed you can add a few plain knit rounds in mc before starting the toe to figure out when to start the toe know that the toe has 18 20 22 24 rounds divide by your stockinette row gauge and that is how long the toe will be for example i am knitting size m and my row gauge is 11 so my toe will measure 20 / 11 = 1 8 and i should start the toe when i am 1 8 short of my desired foot length toe cut cc using mc knit 2 rounds if necessary knit additional rounds to achieve the correct foot length before toe decreases begin setup round 1 decrease on instep only k1 ssk k to 3 sts before the end of the instep k2tog k1 k to bor instep and sole each have 27 31 35 39 sts now setup round 2 k all sts work the following two rounds 5 6 7 8 times until 34 38 42 46 total sts remain round 1 decrease round k1 ssk k to 3 sts before the end of the instep k2tog k1 k1 ssk k to 3 sts before bor k2tog k1 round 2 k all sts work round 1 only 4 more times until 18 22 26 30 total sts remain or until desired pointiness then graft the toe using kitchener stitch you can eliminate ears by treating the 2nd and 3rd stitches from each end as a single stitch when grafting so when you knit on or knit off you pass the needle through both stitches as if working a k2tog and when you
